sentence.text: MiR-93-5p has been previously found to be associated with gastric cancer (vitamin D metabolic process) tumorigenesis; however, the current understanding of its function in this context remains largely incomplete.

MiR-93-5p upregulation was also shown to inhibit the expression of two well-characterized Hippo pathway regulators, protocadherin positive regulation of cell-matrix adhesion 4 (heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules), and large tumor suppressors 2 (G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle), at both the mRNA and protein level.

entity.text: heterophilic cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules
G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle
